references.paper_title: Probabilistic reasoning in intelligent systems: networks of plausible inference
references.reason: This book is a foundational work in probabilistic graphical models, providing the theoretical basis for many of the methods discussed in the paper.
This paper introduces a linearized version of belief propagation which provides the groundwork for LinUProp's linear approach to uncertainty quantification.

references.paper_title: The power of certainty: A dirichlet-multinomial model for belief propagation
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it proposes a method for uncertainty quantification in graphical models, addressing some of the same challenges that LinUProp tackles.

references.paper_title: SocNL: Bayesian label propagation with confidence
references.reason: This paper presents a method for uncertainty quantification in graphical models and serves as a direct comparison to the LinUProp method.

references.paper_title: An introduction to variational methods for graphical models
references.reason: This paper is a foundational work in variational inference, which provides a context for understanding the relationship between LinUProp and sampling-based approaches to uncertainty quantification.
